alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 21 at 3:20AM MST until December 22 at 12:00PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, snow and wind expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Eastern Uinta Mountains. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 6 AM Wednesday to midnight MST Wednesday night. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 8 PM Wednesday to noon MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
